text.p: Code-Alarm Inc said on Tuesday it filed for an extension in submitting its Form 10-K and added it expects to report a loss for the year that significantly exceeds the $2.7 million loss it took for 1995.
The company said the extension was needed to finalize the results of its European operations, which it is discontinuing.

Code-Alarm said it will take a pre-tax charge of at least $7 million from the decision to discontinue European operations. The company will continue to supply and service its European customers while it seeks a buyer for the assets of those operations.

The company forecast a return to profitability in 1997. It said its 1996 loss will place it under the minimum requirements for Nasdaq's National Market listing, but it will work with Nasdaq to maintain active trading in its stock.
Code-Alarm shares closed Tuesday at 2-3/4, unchanged on the day.
